events.name: cameraready
events.summary: Fires when the camera overlay is ready to take pictures.

events.name: linechange

deprecated.notes: Titanium no longer fires this event. Use the routechange event instead.

events.summary: Fired when an audio line type change is detected.

events.name: recordinginput

deprecated.notes: Titanium no longer fires this event. Use the canRecord property to check if an input hardware is available.

events.summary: Fired when the availablity of recording input changes.

properties.name: available
properties.summary: Indicates whether the recording device is available.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: routechange
events.summary: Fired when an audio line type change is detected.

properties.name: reason
properties.summary: The reason for route change.

properties.name: oldRoute
properties.summary: Returns a description of the old route, consisting of zero or more input ports and zero or more output ports.

properties.name: currentRoute
properties.summary: Returns a description of the current route, consisting of zero or more input ports and zero or more output ports.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

properties.name: volume
properties.summary: New volume level in dB.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

methods.name: beep
methods.summary: Plays a device beep notification.

parameters.name: parameters

methods.name: createSystemAlert

deprecated.notes: This iOS-only API has been deprecated and moved to the Ti.SystemAlert module in 8.0.0.

methods.summary: Creates and returns an instance of Titanium.Media.SystemAlert.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.summary: Properties to set on a new object, including any defined by Titanium.Media.SystemAlert except those marked not-creation or read-only.

methods.name: createVideoPlayer

parameters.name: parameters

methods.name: hasAudioPermissions

deprecated.notes: Use hasAudioRecorderPermissions instead.

methods.summary: Returns true if the app has audio permissions.
methods.description:
Recording audio requires explicit permission from the user. After the user grants or denies permission, the system remembers the choice for future use in the same app. If permission is not granted, or if the user has not yet responded to the permission prompt, any audio recording sessions record only silence.

In addition, Apple introduced the Info.plist key NSMicrophoneUsageDescription that is used to display an own description while authorizing microphone permissions. In iOS 10, this key is mandatory and the application will crash if your app does not include the key. Check the Apple docs for more information.

methods.name: hasAudioRecorderPermissions
methods.summary: Returns true if the app has audio permissions.
methods.description:
Recording audio requires explicit permission from the user. After the user grants or denies permission, the system remembers the choice for future use in the same app. If permission is not granted, or if the user has not yet responded to the permission prompt, any audio recording sessions record only silence.

In addition, Apple introduced the Info.plist key NSMicrophoneUsageDescription that is used to display an own description while authorizing microphone permissions. In iOS 10, this key is mandatory and the application will crash if your app does not include the key. Check the Apple docs for more information.

methods.name: hasCameraPermissions
methods.summary: Returns true if the app has camera access.

methods.name: hasMusicLibraryPermissions
methods.summary: Returns true if the app has music library access.
methods.description: Music-library permissions are only needed in iOS 9.3 and later and will be ignored on older iOS versions. Because of that, the method will return true for devices that run iOS < 9.3.

methods.name: hasPhotoGalleryPermissions
methods.summary: Returns true if the app has photo gallery permissions.

methods.name: hideCamera
methods.summary: Hides the device camera UI.
methods.description: Must be called after calling showCamera and only when autohide is set to false. This method causes the media capture UI to be hidden.

methods.name: hideMusicLibrary
methods.summary: Hides the music library.
methods.description: Must be called after calling openMusicLibrary and only when autohide is set to false.

methods.name: isMediaTypeSupported
methods.summary: Returns true if the source supports the specified media type.
methods.description:
You can query whether a given media type is supported by the device's camera (source == 'camera') or photo library (source == 'photo').

An additional value, photogallery can be used to query the media supported by the device's camera roll or saved image album, which is a subset of the iOS photo library. However, when calling openPhotoGallery on iOS, the entire library is displayed, and there is currently no way to restrict the gallery to show only the camera roll/saved images album.

parameters.name: source
parameters.summary: Media source specified as a string: camera for Camera or photo for Photo Library.

parameters.name: type
parameters.summary: Media type to check.

methods.name: openMusicLibrary
methods.summary: Shows the music library and allows the user to select one or more tracks.
methods.description: If autohide is set to false, you must hide the library explicitly using hideMusicLibrary.

parameters.name: options
parameters.summary: A dictionary of options as described in MusicLibraryOptionsType.

methods.name: openPhotoGallery
methods.summary: Opens the photo gallery image picker.
methods.description: In iOS 6, Apple introduced the Info.plist key NSPhotoLibraryUsageDescription that is used to display an own description while authorizing gallery permissions. In iOS 10, this key is mandatory and the application will crash if your app does not include the key. Check the Apple docs for more information.

parameters.name: options
parameters.summary: Photo gallery options as described in PhotoGalleryOptionsType.

methods.name: previewImage
methods.summary: Displays the given image.

parameters.name: options
parameters.summary: Dictionary containing the image and callback functions.

methods.name: queryMusicLibrary
methods.summary: Searches the music library for items matching the specified search predicates.
methods.description: Use hasMusicLibraryPermissions to check the granted permissions and requestMusicLibraryPermissions to request the permissions. This is especially important when running on an iOS 10 device, because the music-library access will crash without having the privacy-key NSAppleMusicUsageDescription that is specified in requestMusicLibraryPermissions.

parameters.name: query
parameters.summary: The query object to extract information from.

methods.name: requestAudioPermissions

deprecated.notes: Use requestAudioRecorderPermissions instead.

methods.summary: Request the user's permission for audio recording.
methods.description:
Recording audio requires explicit permission from the user. After the user grants or denies permission, the system remembers the choice for future use in the same app. If permission is not granted, or if the user has not yet responded to the permission prompt, any audio recording sessions record only silence.

In addition, Apple introduced the Info.plist key NSMicrophoneUsageDescription that is used to display an own description while authorizing microphone permissions. In iOS 10, this key is mandatory and the application will crash if your app does not include the key. Check the Apple docs for more information.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.summary: Callback function to execute when the users responds to the authorization alert.

methods.name: requestAudioRecorderPermissions
methods.summary: Request the user's permission for audio recording.
methods.description:
Recording audio requires explicit permission from the user. After the user grants or denies permission, the system remembers the choice for future use in the same app. If permission is not granted, or if the user has not yet responded to the permission prompt, any audio recording sessions record only silence.

In addition, Apple introduced the Info.plist key NSMicrophoneUsageDescription that is used to display an own description while authorizing microphone permissions. In iOS 10, this key is mandatory and the application will crash if your app does not include the key. Check the Apple docs for more information.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.summary: Callback function to execute when the users responds to the authorization alert.

methods.name: requestAuthorization

deprecated.notes: Use requestAudioRecorderPermissions instead.

methods.summary: Request the user's permission for audio recording.
methods.description:
Recording audio requires explicit permission from the user. After the user grants or denies permission, the system remembers the choice for future use in the same app. If permission is not granted, or if the user has not yet responded to the permission prompt, any audio recording sessions record only silence.

In addition, Apple introduced the Info.plist key NSMicrophoneUsageDescription that is used to display an own description while authorizing microphone permissions. In iOS 10, this key is mandatory and the application will crash if your app does not include the key. Check the Apple docs for more information.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.summary: Callback function to execute when the users responds to the authorization alert.

methods.name: requestCameraAccess

deprecated.notes: Please use requestCameraPermissions instead.

methods.summary: Requests for camera access.
methods.description: This method allows the app to request for camera access, before or without the user granting it in showCamera. The request view will only show if user has not yet made a decision. If he has, the callback will return his earlier decision, and if any changes has to be made, the user has to change it in the device settings.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.summary: Function to call upon user decision to grant camera access.

methods.name: requestCameraPermissions
methods.summary: Requests for camera access.
methods.description:
On Android, the request view will show if the permission is not accepted by the user, and the user did not check the box "Never ask again" when denying the request. If the user checks the box "Never ask again," the user has to manually enable the permission in device settings.

This method requests Manifest.permission.CAMERA, Manifest.permission.READ_EXTERNAL_STORAGE and Manifest.permission.WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE on Android. If you require other permissions, you can also use requestPermissions.

In iOS 6, Apple introduced the Info.plist key NSCameraUsageDescription that is used to display an own description while authorizing camera permissions. In iOS 10, this key is mandatory when taking a photo and the application will crash if your app does not include the key. Check the Apple docs for more information. When using the camera to take a video, you also need the NSMicrophoneUsageDescription key. In addition, the authorization dialog will only show if user has not made a decision, yet. If the user has, the callback will return the earlier decision. To change the permission the user needs to change it in the device settings.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.summary: Function to call upon user decision to grant camera access.

methods.name: requestMusicLibraryPermissions
methods.summary: Request permissions for the native music-library.
methods.description:
Music-library permissions are only needed in iOS 9.3 and later and will be ignored on older iOS versions. Because of that, the callback will ignore the permission-check and always return {success: true} for devices that run iOS < 9.3.

Important: On iOS 10, Apple introduced the Info.plist key NSAppleMusicUsageDescription that is used to display an own description while authorizing the music library. This key is mandatory and the application will crash if your app does not include the key. Check the Apple docs for more information.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.summary: Function to call upon user decision to grant camera access.

methods.name: requestPhotoGalleryPermissions
methods.summary: Requests for photo gallery permissions.
methods.description:
In iOS 6, Apple introduced the Info.plist key NSPhotoLibraryUsageDescription that is used to display an own description while authorizing photo gallery permissions. In iOS 10, this key is mandatory when accessing the photo gallery and the application will crash if your app does not include the key. Check the Apple docs for more information. If the user has, the callback will return the earlier decision. To change the permission the user needs to change it in the device settings.

iOS Apps that do not include this method, will present the system-dialog while the dialog is opened with openPhotoGallery.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.summary: Function to call upon user decision to grant camera access.

methods.name: saveToPhotoGallery
methods.summary: Saves media to the device's photo gallery / camera roll.
methods.description:
This operation is asynchronous. The caller can supply callbacks to be triggered when the save operation completes.

Media can be passed as either a Blob object or a File object. If the media argument is not one of these types, an error is generated.

Note that when passing a file (or a blob created from a file), the file name must have the appropriate extension for the data--for example, image.jpg or video1.mov work, but video1.tmp does not. Currently, the .mp4 extension is not supported, but MP4 files may be imported by saving them with the .mov extension.

On Android this method only supports saving images to the device gallery prior to Titanium SDK 6.1.0.

On iOS the NSPhotoLibraryAddUsageDescription plist key is required in the tiapp.xml in order to use this API. Also make sure to check for the gallery permissions with hasPhotoGalleryPermissions and request the permissions with requestPhotoGalleryPermissions if not granted so far.

parameters.name: media
parameters.summary: Media to save to the camera roll or media gallery.

parameters.name: callbacks
parameters.summary: Pass a dictionary with the following supported keys: success a function that will be called when the save succeeds, and error a function that will be called upon receiving an error.

methods.name: setOverrideAudioRoute
methods.summary: Overrides the default audio route when using the AUDIO_SESSION_CATEGORY_PLAY_AND_RECORD session mode.
methods.description:
By default, when using the AUDIO_SESSION_CATEGORY_PLAY_AND_RECORD session mode, the audio output is routed to the speaker in the receiver. This method lets you specify that audio should be routed to the built-in speaker.

If you override the audio route while audio is playing the changes won't not take effect until the audio is restarted.

parameters.name: route
parameters.summary: The specified audio route.

methods.name: showCamera
methods.summary: Shows the camera.
methods.description:
By default, the native camera controls are displayed. To add your own camera controls, you can add an overlay view by setting the overlay property on the options argument.

# Android Platform Notes

  • To suppress the default controls, set autohide to false and then set the overlay property to a view that contains a control (such as a button) to take the photo. You must then control the camera explicitly, using the takePicture and hideCamera methods.
  • Setting saveToPhotoGallery to false is not guaranteed to work with all camera apps. If this setting is desired, then you should use Titanium's internal camera overlay instead.
  • You can only use one or the other (video or photo) types in the array.

# iOS Platform Notes

To suppress the default controls, set showControls and autohide to false.

If the showControls option is false, you must control the camera explicitly, using the takePicture and hideCamera methods.

Images taken with the camera will not have accurate geolocation data embedded in the images; the latitude and longitude will be set to '0'. This is not an error, but a limitation which Apple has put on the camera API.

Important: Use hasCameraPermissions and requestCameraPermissions to ask for camera permissions. This is especially important when running on iOS 10 and later, since the application may crash otherwise.

parameters.name: options
parameters.summary: A dictionary of camera options as described in CameraOptionsType.

methods.name: startMicrophoneMonitor
methods.summary: Starts monitoring the microphone sound level.

methods.name: startVideoCapture
methods.summary: Starts video capture using the camera specified.

methods.name: stopMicrophoneMonitor
methods.summary: Stops monitoring the microphone sound level.

methods.name: stopVideoCapture
methods.summary: Stops video capture using the camera specified.

methods.name: switchCamera
methods.summary: Switches between front and rear-facing cameras. Make sure to set one of the below constants to determine the camera you want to switch to.
methods.description: In Android, this can only be called when using a custom overlay (see showCamera).

parameters.name: camera
parameters.summary: Constant indicating to which camera you want to switch.

methods.name: takePicture
methods.summary: Uses the device camera to capture a photo.
methods.description:
Must be called after calling showCamera and only when autohide is set to false.

This method causes the media capture device to capture a photo and call the success callback.

methods.name: takeScreenshot
methods.summary: Takes a screen shot of the visible UI on the device.
methods.description: This method is asynchronous. The screenshot is returned in the callback argument. The callback argument's media property contains the screenshot image as a Titanium.Blob object.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.summary: Function to call upon capture.

methods.name: vibrate
methods.summary: Makes the device vibrate.
methods.description:
On Android, a pattern argument can be provided to specify a vibration pattern.

The pattern is an array of Number values. Each number in the array is interpreted as a duration in milliseconds. The first number is the delay before the pattern starts, and the remaining numbers are interpreted as alternating periods of on and off times. For example, the following pattern:

[ 0, 500, 100, 500, 100, 500 ]

Would cause the vibration to start immediately (delay = 0), and perform three long vibrations (500 ms) separated by short pauses (100ms).

parameters.name: pattern
parameters.summary: Array of values identifying a vibrate pattern (only used on Android).

properties.name: appMusicPlayer
properties.summary: An instance of Titanium.Media.MusicPlayer representing the app-specific music player.

properties.name: audioLineType

deprecated.notes: Use currentRoute instead.

properties.summary: Returns the line type constant for the current line type.

properties.name: audioPlaying

properties.name: audioSessionCategory
properties.summary: A constant for the audio session category to be used.
properties.description:
Set to one of the AUDIO_SESSION_CATEGORY constants defined in Titanium.Media.

Must be set while the audio session is inactive (no sounds are playing, no listeners for audio properties on the Media module, but the iPod may be active).

properties.name: audioSessionMode

deprecated.notes: Use audioSessionCategory instead.

properties.summary: A constant for the audio session mode to be used.
properties.description:
Set to one of the AUDIO_SESSION_MODE constants defined in Titanium.Media.

Must be set while the audio session is inactive (no sounds are playing, no listeners for audio properties on the Media module, but the iPod may be active).

properties.name: availableCameraMediaTypes
properties.summary: Array of media type constants supported for the camera.

properties.name: availableCameras
properties.summary: Array indicating which cameras are available, CAMERA_FRONT, CAMERA_REAR or both.

properties.name: availablePhotoGalleryMediaTypes
properties.summary: Array of media type constants supported for saving to the device's camera roll or saved images album.

properties.name: availablePhotoMediaTypes
properties.summary: Array of media type constants supported for the photo library.

properties.name: averageMicrophonePower
properties.summary: Current average microphone level in dB or -1 if microphone monitoring is disabled.

properties.name: cameraAuthorization
properties.summary: Returns the authorization status for the camera.

properties.name: cameraAuthorizationStatus

deprecated.notes: Use cameraAuthorization instead.

properties.summary: Returns the authorization status for the camera.

properties.name: cameraFlashMode
properties.summary: Determines how the flash is fired when using the device's camera.

properties.name: canRecord
properties.summary: true if the device has a recording input device available.

properties.name: currentRoute
properties.summary: Returns a description of the current route, consisting of zero or more input ports and zero or more output ports.

properties.name: isCameraSupported
properties.summary: true if the device has camera support.

properties.name: peakMicrophonePower
properties.summary: Current microphone level peak power in dB or -1 if microphone monitoring is disabled.

properties.name: QUALITY_640x480
properties.summary: Media type constant for medium-quality video recording.
properties.description: If recording, specifies that you want to use VGA-quality video recording (pixel dimensions of 640x480).

properties.name: QUALITY_IFRAME_1280x720
properties.summary: Media type constant for medium-quality video recording.
properties.description: If recording, specifies that you want to use 1280x720 iFrame format.

properties.name: QUALITY_IFRAME_960x540
properties.summary: Media type constant for medium-quality video recording.
properties.description: If recording, specifies that you want to use 960x540 iFrame format.

properties.name: systemMusicPlayer
properties.summary: An instance of Titanium.Media.MusicPlayer representing the system-wide music player.

properties.name: volume
properties.summary: Current volume of the playback device.
properties.description: A value in the range 0.0 to 1.0, with 0.0 representing the minimum volume and 1.0 representing the maximum volume.

constants.name: AUDIO_SESSION_CATEGORY_AMBIENT
constants.summary: For long-duration sounds such as rain, car engine noise, and so on.
constants.description:
Also used for for 'play along' style applications, such a virtual piano that a user plays over iPod audio.

See also: AUDIO_SESSION_CATEGORY_SOLO_AMBIENT.

constants.name: AUDIO_SESSION_CATEGORY_PLAY_AND_RECORD
constants.summary: Session mode for recording (input) and playback (output) of audio, such as for a VOIP (voice over IP) application.
constants.description:
This category is appropriate for simultaneous recording and playback, and also for applications that record and play back but not simultaneously. If you want to ensure that sounds such as Messages alerts do not play while your application is recording, use AUDIO_SESSION_CATEGORY_RECORD instead. This category normally disallows mixing iPod audio with application audio.

In this mode, by default audio playback is routed to the speaker in the iPhone receiver. To have audio playback through the iPhone speaker, use setOverrideAudioRoute.

constants.name: AUDIO_SESSION_CATEGORY_PLAYBACK
constants.summary: Session mode for playing recorded music or other sounds that are central to the successful use of your application.
constants.description: When using this mode, your application audio continues with the Ring/Silent switch set to silent or when the screen locks. This property normally disallows mixing iPod audio with application audio.

constants.name: AUDIO_SESSION_CATEGORY_RECORD
constants.summary: Session mode for recording audio; it silences playback audio.

constants.name: AUDIO_SESSION_CATEGORY_SOLO_AMBIENT
constants.summary: Session mode for long-duration sounds such as rain, car engine noise, and so on.
constants.description:
When you use this category, audio from built-in applications, such as the iPod, is silenced. Your audio is silenced when the Ring/Silent switch is set to silent or when the screen locks.

To use long-duration sounds without silencing built-in applications, see AUDIO_SESSION_CATEGORY_AMBIENT.

constants.name: AUDIO_SESSION_MODE_AMBIENT

deprecated.notes: Deprecated in favor of the AUDIO_SESSION_CATEGORY constants defined in Titanium.Media.

constants.summary: For long-duration sounds such as rain, car engine noise, and so on.
constants.description:
Also used for for 'play along' style applications, such a virtual piano that a user plays over iPod audio.

See also: AUDIO_SESSION_MODE_SOLO_AMBIENT.

constants.name: AUDIO_SESSION_MODE_PLAY_AND_RECORD

deprecated.notes: Deprecated in favor of the AUDIO_SESSION_CATEGORY constants defined in Titanium.Media.

constants.summary: Session mode for recording (input) and playback (output) of audio, such as for a VOIP (voice over IP) application.
constants.description:
This category is appropriate for simultaneous recording and playback, and also for applications that record and play back but not simultaneously. If you want to ensure that sounds such as Messages alerts do not play while your application is recording, use AUDIO_SESSION_CATEGORY_RECORD instead. This category normally disallows mixing iPod audio with application audio.

In this mode, by default audio playback is routed to the speaker in the iPhone receiver. To have audio playback through the iPhone speaker, use setOverrideAudioRoute.

constants.name: AUDIO_SESSION_MODE_PLAYBACK

deprecated.notes: Deprecated in favor of the AUDIO_SESSION_CATEGORY constants defined in Titanium.Media.

constants.summary: Session mode for playing recorded music or other sounds that are central to the successful use of your application.
constants.description: When using this mode, your application audio continues with the Ring/Silent switch set to silent or when the screen locks. This property normally disallows mixing iPod audio with application audio.

constants.name: AUDIO_SESSION_MODE_RECORD

deprecated.notes: Deprecated in favor of the AUDIO_SESSION_CATEGORY_* constants defined in Titanium.Media.

constants.summary: Session mode for recording audio; it silences playback audio.

constants.name: AUDIO_SESSION_MODE_SOLO_AMBIENT

deprecated.notes: Deprecated in favor of the AUDIO_SESSION_CATEGORY constants defined in Titanium.Media.

constants.summary: Session mode for long-duration sounds such as rain, car engine noise, and so on.
constants.description:
When you use this category, audio from built-in applications, such as the iPod, is silenced. Your audio is silenced when the Ring/Silent switch is set to silent or when the screen locks.

To use long-duration sounds without silencing built-in applications, see AUDIO_SESSION_MODE_AMBIENT.

constants.name: AUDIO_SESSION_OVERRIDE_ROUTE_NONE
constants.summary: Constant that specifies audio should output to the default audio route. See setOverrideAudioRoute for more information.

constants.name: AUDIO_SESSION_OVERRIDE_ROUTE_SPEAKER
constants.summary: Constant that specifies audio should output to the speaker. See setOverrideAudioRoute for more information.

constants.name: AUDIO_SESSION_PORT_AIRPLAY
constants.summary: Constant for output on a remote Air Play device. This is an output port.

constants.name: AUDIO_SESSION_PORT_BLUETOOTHA2DP
constants.summary: Constant for output on a Bluetooth A2DP device. This is an output port.

constants.name: AUDIO_SESSION_PORT_BLUETOOTHHFP
constants.summary: Constant for input or output on a Bluetooth Hands-Free Profile device. This can be both an input and output port.

constants.name: AUDIO_SESSION_PORT_BLUETOOTHLE
constants.summary: Constant for output on a Bluetooth Low Energy device. This is an output port. This is available on iOS7 and later.

constants.name: AUDIO_SESSION_PORT_BUILTINMIC
constants.summary: Constant for built-in microphone on an iOS device. This is an input port.

constants.name: AUDIO_SESSION_PORT_BUILTINRECEIVER
constants.summary: Constant for the speaker you hold to your ear when on a phone call. This is an output port.

constants.name: AUDIO_SESSION_PORT_BUILTINSPEAKER
constants.summary: Constant for built-in speaker on an iOS device. This is an output port.

constants.name: AUDIO_SESSION_PORT_CARAUDIO
constants.summary: Constant for Input or output via Car Audio. This can be both an input and output port. This is available on iOS7 and later.

constants.name: AUDIO_SESSION_PORT_HDMI
constants.summary: Constant for output via High-Definition Multimedia Interface. This is an output port

constants.name: AUDIO_SESSION_PORT_HEADPHONES
constants.summary: Constant for headphone or headset output. This is an output port.

constants.name: AUDIO_SESSION_PORT_HEADSETMIC
constants.summary: Constant for microphone on a wired headset. This is an input port.

constants.name: AUDIO_SESSION_PORT_LINEIN
constants.summary: Constant for line level input on a dock connector. This is an input port.

constants.name: AUDIO_SESSION_PORT_LINEOUT
constants.summary: Constant for line level output on a dock connector. This is an output port.

constants.name: AUDIO_SESSION_PORT_USBAUDIO
constants.summary: Constant for input or output on a Universal Serial Bus device. This can be both an input and output port.

constants.name: AUDIO_SPEAKER

deprecated.notes: Deprecated in favor of the AUDIO_SESSION_PORT constants defined in Titanium.Media.

constants.summary: Line-type constant for speaker output.

constants.name: CAMERA_AUTHORIZATION_NOT_DETERMINED

deprecated.notes: Use CAMERA_AUTHORIZATION_UNKNOWN instead.

constants.summary: Constant specifying that app is restricted from using camera. This is available on iOS7 and later.

constants.name: CAMERA_AUTHORIZATION_UNKNOWN
constants.summary: Constant specifying that app is not yet authorized to use camera. This is available on iOS7 and later.

constants.name: CAMERA_FLASH_AUTO
constants.summary: Constant specifying to have the device determine to use the flash or not.

constants.name: CAMERA_FLASH_OFF
constants.summary: Constant specifying to never fire the flash.

constants.name: CAMERA_FLASH_ON
constants.summary: Constant specifying to always fire the flash.

constants.name: CAMERA_FRONT
constants.summary: Constant specifying the front camera.

constants.name: CAMERA_REAR
constants.summary: Constant indicating the rear camera.

constants.name: DEVICE_BUSY

constants.name: NO_CAMERA
constants.summary: Constant for media no camera error.

constants.name: NO_VIDEO
constants.summary: Constant for media no video error.

constants.name: QUALITY_HIGH
constants.summary: Media type constant for high-quality video recording.
constants.description: Recorded files are suitable for on-device playback and for wired transfer to the Desktop using Image Capture; they are likely to be too large for transfer using Wi-Fi.

constants.name: QUALITY_LOW
constants.summary: Media type constant for low-quality video recording.
constants.description: Recorded files can usually be transferred over the cellular network.

constants.name: QUALITY_MEDIUM
constants.summary: Media type constant for medium-quality video recording.
constants.description: Recorded files can usually be transferred using Wi-Fi. This is the default video quality setting.

constants.name: UNKNOWN_ERROR
constants.summary: Constant for unknown media error.

constants.name: VIDEO_CONTROL_DEFAULT

deprecated.notes: This property has been removed for iOS in Titanium SDK 7.0.0 as of the official deprecation by Apple.

constants.summary: Constant for default video controls.
constants.description: Used in conjunction with the mediaControlStyle property of Titanium.Media.VideoPlayer.

constants.name: VIDEO_CONTROL_EMBEDDED

deprecated.notes: This property has been removed for iOS in Titanium SDK 7.0.0 as of the official deprecation by Apple.

constants.summary: Constant for video controls for an embedded view.
constants.description:
Used in conjunction with the mediaControlStyle property of Titanium.Media.VideoPlayer.

On Android, this constant has the same effect as VIDEO_CONTROL_DEFAULT. Video controls may only be shown or hidden.

constants.name: VIDEO_CONTROL_FULLSCREEN

deprecated.notes: This property has been removed for iOS in Titanium SDK 7.0.0 as of the official deprecation by Apple.

constants.summary: Constant for fullscreen video controls.
constants.description:
Used in conjunction with the mediaControlStyle property of Titanium.Media.VideoPlayer.

On iOS, use VIDEO_CONTROL_FULLSCREEN when creating a video player that occupies the entire screen, that is, the parent window should be a fullscreen window (fullscreen set to true) and the video player should occupy the entirety of the parent window.

If the user clicks the Done button in the fullscreen control bar, the video player pauses playback and generates a complete event.

Note that if you create a video player that does not occupy the entire screen, and later switch to fullscreen mode, the video controls are switched automatically. That is, if mediaControlStyle is set to VIDEO_CONTROL_DEFAULT or VIDEO_CONTROL_EMBEDDED, it is automatically switched to the fullscreen controls when the player enters fullscreen mode. This is true whether the user initiates the mode switch by clicking the fullscreen button in the embedded controls, or if you programmatically switch to full screen mode (by setting the fullscreen property to true).

On Android, this constant has the same effect as VIDEO_CONTROL_DEFAULT. Video controls may only be shown or hidden.

constants.name: VIDEO_CONTROL_HIDDEN
constants.summary: Constant for video controls hidden.
constants.description: Used in conjunction with the mediaControlStyle property of Titanium.Media.VideoPlayer.

constants.name: VIDEO_CONTROL_NONE
constants.summary: Constant for no video controls.
constants.description: Used in conjunction with the mediaControlStyle property of Titanium.Media.VideoPlayer.

constants.name: VIDEO_CONTROL_VOLUME_ONLY

deprecated.notes: Use VIDEO_CONTROL_EMBEDDED instead.

constants.summary: Constant for video controls volume only.

constants.name: VIDEO_FINISH_REASON_PLAYBACK_ENDED
constants.summary: Video playback ended normally.

constants.name: VIDEO_FINISH_REASON_PLAYBACK_ERROR
constants.summary: Video playback ended abnormally.

constants.name: VIDEO_FINISH_REASON_USER_EXITED
constants.summary: Video playback ended by user action (such as clicking the Done button).

constants.name: VIDEO_LOAD_STATE_FAILED
constants.summary: Indicates that the player can no longer play media items because of an error.

constants.name: VIDEO_LOAD_STATE_PLAYABLE
constants.summary: Current media is playable.

constants.name: VIDEO_LOAD_STATE_PLAYTHROUGH_OK

deprecated.notes: This property has been removed for iOS in Titanium SDK 7.0.0 as of the official deprecation by Apple.

constants.summary: Playback will be automatically started in this state when autoplay is true.

constants.name: VIDEO_LOAD_STATE_STALLED

deprecated.notes: This property has been removed for iOS in Titanium SDK 7.0.0 as of the official deprecation by Apple.

constants.summary: Playback will be automatically paused in this state, if started.

constants.name: VIDEO_LOAD_STATE_UNKNOWN
constants.summary: Current load state is not known.

constants.name: VIDEO_MEDIA_TYPE_AUDIO

deprecated.notes: This property has been removed in Titanium SDK 7.0.0 as of the official deprecation by Apple.

constants.summary: A audio type of media in the movie returned by Titanium.Media.VideoPlayer mediaTypes property.

constants.name: VIDEO_MEDIA_TYPE_NONE

deprecated.notes: This property has been removed in Titanium SDK 7.0.0 as of the official deprecation by Apple.

constants.summary: An unknown type of media in the movie returned by Titanium.Media.VideoPlayer mediaTypes property.

constants.name: VIDEO_MEDIA_TYPE_VIDEO

deprecated.notes: This property has been removed in Titanium SDK 7.0.0 as of the official deprecation by Apple.

constants.summary: A video type of media in the movie returned by Titanium.Media.VideoPlayer mediaTypes property.

constants.name: VIDEO_PLAYBACK_STATE_INTERRUPTED
constants.summary: Video playback has been interrupted.

constants.name: VIDEO_PLAYBACK_STATE_PAUSED
constants.summary: Video playback is paused.

constants.name: VIDEO_PLAYBACK_STATE_PLAYING
constants.summary: Video is being played.

constants.name: VIDEO_PLAYBACK_STATE_SEEKING_BACKWARD

deprecated.notes: This constant has been removed on iOS by using the official Apple AVPlayer that does not expose this functionality so far.

constants.summary: Video playback is rewinding.

constants.name: VIDEO_PLAYBACK_STATE_SEEKING_FORWARD

deprecated.notes: This constant has been removed on iOS by using the official Apple AVPlayer that does not expose this functionality so far.

constants.summary: Video playback is seeking forward.

constants.name: VIDEO_PLAYBACK_STATE_STOPPED
constants.summary: Video playback is stopped.

constants.name: VIDEO_REPEAT_MODE_NONE
constants.summary: Constant for disabling repeat on video playback.

constants.name: VIDEO_REPEAT_MODE_ONE
constants.summary: Constant for repeating one video (i.e., the one video will repeat constantly) during playback.

constants.name: VIDEO_SCALING_ASPECT_FILL

deprecated.notes: This property has been removed for iOS in Titanium SDK 7.0.0 as of the official deprecation by Apple.

constants.summary: Scale video to fill the screen, clipping edges if necessary.
constants.description: Video is scaled until the video fills the entire screen. Content at the edges of the larger of the two dimensions is clipped so that the other dimension fits the screen exactly. The aspect ratio of the movie is preserved.

constants.name: VIDEO_SCALING_ASPECT_FIT

deprecated.notes: This property has been removed for iOS in Titanium SDK 7.0.0 as of the official deprecation by Apple.

constants.summary: Scale video to fit the screen, letterboxing if necessary.
constants.description: Video is scaled until the larger dimension fits on the screen exactly. In the other dimension, the region between the edge of the movie and the edge of the screen is filled with a black bar. The aspect ratio of the movie is preserved.

constants.name: VIDEO_SCALING_MODE_FILL

deprecated.notes: This property has been removed for iOS in Titanium SDK 7.0.0 as of the official deprecation by Apple.

constants.summary: Video is scaled until both dimensions fit the screen exactly, stretching if necessary.
constants.description: The aspect ratio of the video is not preserved.

constants.name: VIDEO_SCALING_NONE

deprecated.notes: This property has been removed for iOS in Titanium SDK 7.0.0 as of the official deprecation by Apple.

constants.summary: Video scaling is disabled.

constants.name: VIDEO_SCALING_RESIZE
constants.summary: Specifies that the video should be stretched to fill the bounds of layer.

constants.name: VIDEO_SCALING_RESIZE_ASPECT
constants.summary: Specifies that the player should preserve the aspect ratio of video and fit the video within the bounds of layer.

constants.name: VIDEO_SCALING_RESIZE_ASPECT_FILL
constants.summary: Specifies that the player should preserve the aspect ratio of video and fill the bounds of layer.

constants.name: VIDEO_SOURCE_TYPE_FILE

deprecated.notes: This property has been removed in Titanium SDK 7.0.0 as of the official deprecation by Apple.

constants.summary: Video source type is a file.
constants.description: Related to the sourceType property of Titanium.Media.VideoPlayer.

constants.name: VIDEO_SOURCE_TYPE_STREAMING

deprecated.notes: This property has been removed in Titanium SDK 7.0.0 as of the official deprecation by Apple.

constants.summary: Video source type is a remote stream.
constants.description: Related to the sourceType property of Titanium.Media.VideoPlayer

constants.name: VIDEO_SOURCE_TYPE_UNKNOWN

deprecated.notes: This property has been removed in Titanium SDK 7.0.0 as of the official deprecation by Apple.

constants.summary: Video source type is unknown.
constants.description: Related to the sourceType property of Titanium.Media.VideoPlayer

constants.name: VIDEO_TIME_OPTION_CLOSEST_SYNC
constants.summary: Use the closest sync (or key) frame at given the time.

constants.name: VIDEO_TIME_OPTION_EXACT
constants.summary: Use the exact time.

constants.name: VIDEO_TIME_OPTION_NEAREST_KEYFRAME
constants.summary: Use the closest keyframe in the time.

constants.name: VIDEO_TIME_OPTION_NEXT_SYNC
constants.summary: Use the sync (or key) frame located right after or at given the time.

constants.name: VIDEO_TIME_OPTION_PREVIOUS_SYNC
constants.summary: Use the sync (or key) frame located right before or at given the time.
